title: 114_hr245
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. CODIFICATION OF EFFECTIVE DATES FOR CLAIMS UNDER THE LAWS ADMINISTERED BY THE SECRETARY OF VETERANS AFFAIRS." has been condensed to focus on the key information about the effective dates for claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The definitions section of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include terms like claimant, claim, formal claim, and informal claim related to benefits administered by the Secretary. The definitions section of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include terms related to benefits administered by the Secretary, such as claimant, claim, formal claim, and informal claim. This includes criteria for a "reasonably raised claim" and the requirements for submitting a claim for benefits. The table of sections in chapter 51 of title 38, United States Code, is updated by replacing the item for section 5100 with a new item. Section 5100 of title 38, United States Code, defines key terms. Informal claims must be followed by a formal claim application. Informal requests for claim increase or reopening are treated like formal claims. Effective dates for benefit applications are determined based on the date of informal communication submission. The Secretary allows for the filing of an application within 180 days of receiving necessary forms. Reasonably raised claims must be addressed and adjudicated, even if they were not part of the formal claim. The Secretary allows for the filing of an application within 180 days of receiving necessary forms. Reasonably raised claims must be addressed and adjudicated, including evidence relating to separate conditions not part of the formal claim. The amendments made by this Act regarding the treatment of reasonably raised claims will be effective upon enactment and apply to claims submitted thereafter.
